intro: Amphithalea sericea, commonly known as silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in areas with low rainfall. The plant features a low-growing, sprawling habit with hairy, silvery-gray leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming in late summer. Amphithalea sericea is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
